oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Scrap iron drive
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: George Ellis Voorhies, a young child, riding a wagon pulled by two goats. He is collecting scrap iron for the war effort. The sign says 'Buffalo Valley Scraps Will Help Defeat the Axis.'

During World War II, scrap metal drives were a popular way for people to contribute to the war effort. By recycling unused or unwanted metal, the government could build ships, airplanes, and other equipment.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Scrap drives; War work; Goats; Carts & wagons; Goat carts; Signs (Notices); Children
